intro: Arctotis macrostylis, commonly known as the large-styled arctotis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and pink to red petals, blooming from late winter to early summer. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its ornamental value is complemented by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
